Bag O' Links - 29/7/2009

  • Twitter Bot in Ruby – What the hell, they’ll do it anyway, might as well be in Ruby/Rails.
  • Running Rails performance tests on real data – I have been wondering how to do it for years, thank god (or the devil) for Pratik.
  • Search Light – a drop down search suggestion box on JQuery.
  • RT widget – nice, clean, used.
  • Multi-stage environment with Passenger and Capistrano – if you didn’t know how to yet, now is the time.
  • Rails Flash messages on jGrowl – a nice helper to show flash messages with JQuery’s Growl plugin.

GitHub Treasures

  • rails_assviz – visualize your model relationships.
  • octopi – A Ruby interface to GitHub API v2
  • ratboard – Inventory Management System
  • stop-simple-time – a time tracking tool.

Aand a bit of something else…
